subject: Investing
title: Sector Allocation for Income
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sector Allocation for Income usable.

hook.text: An investor put 60% of her income portfolio in energy stocks. When oil crashed, her dividends dropped 40%.

buildup.text: Different sectors have different dividend characteristics: utilities are stable, financials are cyclical, tech is growing.

discovery.text: Blending defensive sectors (utilities, staples, healthcare) with cyclical ones (financials, industrials) smooths income.

twist.text: Even 'safe' sectors face disruption. Telecom dividends seemed bulletproof until cord-cutting accelerated.

climax.text: Cap any single sector at 20-25% of your income portfolio to limit concentration risk.

punchline.text: Spread your income across sectors like crops across fields. One drought won't starve you.

quiz.question: What is a good sector cap for a dividend income portfolio?
